sentences.english: Public Security officials found this amusing and suggested Li was embezzling money.
sentences.chinese: 公安局的官員覺得這個很好笑，並建議李私吞了錢。

sentences.english: He rebuked Lou, director of the stolen property, threatening to the wild man there.
sentences.chinese: 他斥責盧局長私吞公物，揚言要到野夫那裏告狀。

sentences.english: He paid the cash in to his bank account.
sentences.chinese: 他把錢私吞了，存進了自己的銀行帳戶裏。

sentences.english: He kept the money for himself and paid it into his own bank.
sentences.chinese: 他把錢私吞了，存進了自己的銀行帳戶裏。

sentences.english: Mr Jonathan, of course, did not personally take their money.
sentences.chinese: 當然，喬納森本人並沒有私吞這些錢。

sentences.english: If they were Indians, at least some quantity might have been swallowed.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們是印度人，至少會私吞一些。

definition: to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
to sell illicitly/to bootleg/to sell privately
to obtain by impersonation/to falsely claim as one's own
to take for one's own/to expropriate
official authority used for private interests (idiom); to attain private ends by abusing public position
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
